fields.description:
If a customer visits the UPM in their instance, they're presented with a message saying "Only system administrators can install plugins. Please file a support request if you need to install a plugin. Support requests can be filed at support.atlassian.com."

Given that we don't allow any arbitrary plugins to be installed on Studio, this isn't accurate... we should completely do away with this text, and perhaps have a link to the [Plugin Policy|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRASTUDIO/JIRA+Studio+Plugin+Policy] in its place.
fields.summary: Text in UPM is misleading regarding the ability to install plugins

fields.description:
As per this doc http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO030/Granting+Global+Permissions+to+Users+or+Groups, If an user is granted as _Restricted Admin_ in Studio Bamboo (<instance>.jira.com/builds/admin/viewGlobalPermissions!default.action), it should have the following permissions:
- access the Bamboo 'Administration' menu
- create plans
- delete plans 

Although, it's not working and customers need to Bulk edit Bamboo permissions (<instance>.jira.com/builds/admin/chooseBuildsToBulkEditPermissions.action)
fields.summary: Restricted Admin permissions in Bamboo is not working as it should

fields.description:
From Bryan:

We're looking at exposing application names (i.e. application link names) in the end user UX, for things like Activity Streams and Remote Issue Links, to identify the actions taken by a remote application.

Can we make sure that the names make sense in the studio context, i.e. call the app link to JIRA from other apps "Issues", call the app link from JIRA to Bamboo "Builds", and have them match the tab names?

When Studio moves to UAL, whomever in the Studio team is working on the applink configuration, should make sure and use names that would make sense to an end user.
fields.summary: use readable names for AppLinks when migrating to UAL

The cloning feature within the same project is not useful to us at all.

fields.description:
This doc is very important to us, since we spend a lot of time explaining imports to customer. So, I'd like to add a few restrictions/clues about the imports to be added to the doc:

* First of all, I'd put a banner in the very top saying that imports must be scheduled with Support in at least 2 weeks in advance.
* There is a 'Supported Versions' section that is very important! So i guess it should be moved under JIRA import and Confluence import too. This is kinda of the most important info!
* Under JIRA:
** add how to upload the xml to webdav for the import - following the instructions for the customer facing importer (attached)
** add the version restriction
** advise about restricted functions 
** advise about the available plugins
** for project imports, the version must match exactly
* Under Confluence:
** add that it must be scheduled with 2 weeks in advance
** clarify that for 3rd-party imports, they must install a local confluence, respecting studio version
** for space imports, the version must match exactly

fields.description:

# Pick a studio instance with multiple projects
# Create an issue in one of them, say issue 'TESTA-1'.
# Commit a change set that spans multiple projects (either using a client that supports x-project commits like Subclipse, or just by checking out the repo from / (nb: you may need to change permissions to get commit rights to /)) and with a message like: "TESTA-1: #resolve #time 2h #comment This will appear twice"

The issue will get two comments, 4h of time logged, and you will receive a failure notification from the second attempt to resolve the issue.

fields.description:
As a customer where my JIRA studio instance is HTTPS only I'd like the studio instance to advise to the browser that the connection is only HTTPS so that MITM attacks on HTTP or HTTPS will be prevented by the user's browser. The HSTS standard implements this. The HSTS header will be cached so the next connection will automaticly go to the HTTPS site. It also means MITM on HTTPS will not present the user a click-through mechanism to be exploited.

The HSTS is an IETF draft standard being developed by Google. It has a number of existing supported browsers like Firefox4 and Chrome (though I note both these are unsupported browsers). http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HTTP_Strict_Transport_Security

A sample HTTP configuration is here and the HTTPS would involve the same "Header Always set" directive in the Apache HTTPS virtual host (though strictly "Always" isn't required except on HTTP):
https://www.owasp.org/index.php/HTTP_Strict_Transport_Security
fields.summary: hsts deployment

fields.description:
DKIM, RFC4871, is an email signing protocol that allows the recipient of a email to verify if it has been modified since it was sent.

As a customer receiving email notifications I would like to be able to detect forged emails.

Requires the deployment of DKIM signing software (e.g. OpenDKIM, DKIM-Proxy) on the hosted instance and deploying a TXT record corresponding to the public key used to sign.

As the domain XXX.jira.com in an email sense is used exclusively for sending email, a ADSP (RFC5617) policy of "dkim=all" in DNS as _adsp._domainkey.XXX.jira.com could also be used.

was suggested from https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JST-22747
fields.summary: Add DKIM signed to allow the recipient to detect forged emails

fields.description:
The notification system of JIRA is sending emails will full details of our products and problems.

As a customer receiving a JIRA Studio hosted email notification, I want:

the email to travel over TLS where the receiving email server supports this;

such that:

the confidentiality of our reviews are protected from passive interception.

----
The mechanism that supports this is RFC3207. It is an opportunistic extension so the TLS will only be enabled when the receiving email server supports this. As we can see by http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Comparison_of_mail_servers it is widely implemented.

Large email gateways like Yahoo and Google as well as the ISP I work for already implement RC3207 on their email gateways without interoperability issues. Australian Government standards like ISM mandate the use of this SMTP extension http://www.dsd.gov.au/infosec/ism/index.htm

I notice the postfix server can easily support this by adding the following directive in the /etc/postfix/main.cf template:
smtp_tls_security_level = may

copied from: https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JST-22746
fields.summary: enabling smtp tls extension on hosted server

fields.description:
Provide the ability to import sources on a per-project basis.

I see at least 4 major advantages to supporting this:

1. This would likely avoid the need for many people to do any sort of structural alterations to their repositories as described in your documentation.

2. This would allow users to perform multiple imports without replacing the entire repository contents. Currently, each import after the first wipes out the existing repository contents. 

3. This might reduce the number of support requests for help with importing sources. (I don't know how many such requests you get, but I have made several requests myself that could have been eliminated completely by providing the functionality I propose here.)

4. Migration efforts can be planned much more easily since it would allow planning the migration of one project at a time.

Overall, this should save a great deal of time and frustration, for users as well as support staff.

For example, if I were to provide a dump file of the sources for a project with project key MYPROJ, and the dump file contained top level folders named branches, tags, and trunk, then the following command would import the dump file directly under the MYPROJ project folder, and I would have no need to alter the dump file:

    svnadmin load REPOS_PATH --parent-dir MYPROJ < MYPROJ.dump

I suggest you support this as the standard import functionality (or at least provide it as an option). The only additional step for a user that is starting an import of a particular dump file would be to specify which project to import the sources for. By doing this, you would know exactly what value to use for the --parent-dir option in the command above, which would obviously be the project key, since that is the value used for the top level folder for the project.

This would easily allow users to import code for each project at different times. Scheduling migration of every project for an organization from existing repositories to JIRA Studio is not something easy to manage. By allowing import of sources for individual projects, an organization can better manage and plan migration on a project-by-project basis. Migrating them all at once is not a reasonable expectation.

This also better supports existing external repositories commonly structured in any of the following ways:

1. Single project per repository, where branches, tags, and trunk are the top level folders of the repository. What I propose here directly supports this approach because all that is required is a basic dump of the repository -- no changes required. This is fairly common, especially where organization have only one project.

2. Multiple projects per repository, where each project is represented by a top level folder, with branches, tags, and trunk as child folders of each project folder. This would require a bit more effort, but would still be fairly straightforward. The top level project folder could be renamed (by various means) to match the JIRA Studio project key, then could be dumped (to include only everything under the project folder, not the whole repository).

3. Single or multiple projects across multiple repositories. Same approach at above.

The current constraint where ALL project folders must be included in the dump file is far too restrictive and problematic. Allowing importing to a specific project should greatly simply efforts and reduce time spent, both for users and support staff.
fields.summary: Allow SVN import to a specific project

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 17 September 2014|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Hi everyone,
 
Thanks so much for your votes and comments on this issue.
 
Atlassian is working hard on Atlassian Connect, Atlassian's strategic integration platform enabling ecosystem vendors to develop add-ons for Atlassian Cloud (OnDemand). Atlassian Connect 1.0 [was released in March 2014|http://blogs.atlassian.com/2014/03/introducing-atlassian-connect-1-0/], and you can already get access to [more than 50 public add-ons today built using the platform|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/search?application=&category=&cost=&hosting=cloud&marketingLabel=].
 
Due to stability and scalability reasons, we will not bundle additional third party add-ons with our Cloud offerings. But you should feel free to contact the vendors of your favourite add-ons to let them know that you would like them to create a Cloud version of the add-on! We will do our best to work together with the vendor to satisfy this request.
 
Since we have no plans to bundle additional add-ons in Cloud, we are closing this issue.
 
Cheers,
Bartek
JIRA Product Management
bartek (at) atlassian (dot) com
{panel}

fields.description:
So the issue is when you click on a link it takes you to a blank search results page and no users are being show.
This is occurring because the link to the count is not calling a clear search action first. Thus if you have done a user search previously instead of CLEARING that search and applying the NEW search it just applies the new search on TOP of the old search.

Let me illustrate.

*Account page*

Account Name Date.com JIRA (change)
Service Type JIRA Studio (view account)

Developers
Maximum Users 15 (upgrade account)
Number Used 13 (view users)

Collaborators
Maximum Users 5 (upgrade account)
Number Used 6 (view users)

The last (view users) is a link

if you haven't done a username search previously in the session it takes you to the "User Browser" page returns a list of the 6 users who are collaborators

BUT if for example you have previously had a search for say the user "Robin" it takes you to the "User Brower" page but returns a list of NO users since the
previous search for "Robin" is being added to the Collaborators Number User search INSTEAD of doing a brand new search.
fields.summary: Links in the "Account" page to view users of each license type apply search criteria saved in the session

This is a problem for Studio as the sysadmin user does not have this permission (sysadmin doesn't belong to the "developers" group). This is a separate issue and is tracked at https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/AOD-5031 .

This worked fine in 4.3.x and will be a pain point for Support if not fixed.

(Opening here to track it for Studio, but will also raise in JAC)

fields.description:
{color:#FF00FF}*Data setup pre-condition*{color} (i) (?)
* There needs to be more than one version in affects version. Ideally, some in unreleased and some in released.
* You Must be logged in on an iPad :)

{color:#FF00FF}*Steps to reproduce*{color} (i)
# Press +"Create new issue"+ link and select +"Bug"+
# Fill in all required fields
# At the "Affects Version/s" section, select a version on the unreleased side (although it _probably_ does not matter)

{color:#FF00FF}*Actual result*{color} (n) (x)
Observe that the top always get selected in +"Affects Version/s"+

{color:#FF00FF}*Expected result*{color} (y) (/)
The correct version should be selected
fields.summary: Unable to select the correct version in Affects Version/s when using the iPad

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 17 September 2014|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Hi everyone,
 
Thanks so much for your votes and comments on this issue.
 
Atlassian is working hard on Atlassian Connect, Atlassian's strategic integration platform enabling ecosystem vendors to develop add-ons for Atlassian Cloud (OnDemand). Atlassian Connect 1.0 [was released in March 2014|http://blogs.atlassian.com/2014/03/introducing-atlassian-connect-1-0/], and you can already get access to [more than 50 public add-ons today built using the platform|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/search?application=&category=&cost=&hosting=cloud&marketingLabel=].
 
Due to stability and scalability reasons, we will not bundle additional third party add-ons with our Cloud offerings. But you should feel free to contact the vendors of your favourite add-ons to let them know that you would like them to create a Cloud version of the add-on! We will do our best to work together with the vendor to satisfy this request.
 
Since we have no plans to bundle additional add-ons in Cloud, we are closing this issue.
 
Cheers,
Bartek
JIRA Product Management
bartek (at) atlassian (dot) com
{panel}
 
 
*Original request description:*
Please include Improved Clone Issue Operation (ICIO) in JIRA Studio.

Plugin located here - https://plugins.atlassian.com/plugin/details/4997
fields.summary: Please include Improved Clone Issue Operation (ICIO) in JIRA Studio

fields.description:
Steps:
# Create an user on GApps domain:
username: user
First name: Atlassian
Second name: Suppôrt

Actually, any use of an accent mark will result on the same behavior.

It's caused by this bug: http://code.google.com/p/step2/issues/detail?id=35 and the workaround should be to set URIEncoding="UTF-8" on the tomcat connector in server.xml.
fields.summary: GApps wont log in users when their full name has non-ASCII characters

fields.description:
I attempted to log in to SDog - I was on the JIRA Dashboard and clicked the "Log in via Google" link. I was already signed in to Google.

Studio gave me a java.lang.IllegalStateException. Full stack trace:
https://paste.atlassian.com/view/3882

I attempted to navigate to gmail.atlassian.com and got an error message from Google:

!GoogleError.png!

Once Google came back up, SDog started accepting logins again.
fields.summary: SDog threw IllegalStateException while Google was down

fields.description:
I've gotten a couple of customer questions on this and think the purpose of the docs would be clearer if we changed the title of:

[Linking GitHub Repositories with JIRA Studio Projects|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRASTUDIO/Linking+GitHub+Repositories+with+JIRA+Studio+Projects]

to

Linking GitHub Activity to JIRA Issues

and

[Linking Bitbucket Repositories to JIRA Studio Projects|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRASTUDIO/Linking+Bitbucket+Repositories+with+JIRA+Studio+Projects]

to 

Linking Bitbucket Activity to JIRA Issues

Thanks!
fields.summary: Change Name of Bitbucket and GitHub Linking Docs

fields.description:
I wanted to create a review from Source tab of https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/JIM-521
I clicked the _Create crucible review_ link.

I ended up with this: https://studio.atlassian.com/source/cru/CR-82
I can do nothing with this review, esp Abandon it.

As far as I understand, due to some misconfiguration Studio has created a review in a project I have no access rights for.

(I have already created https://studio.atlassian.com/source/cru/CR-JIM-188 which is what I really wanted)
fields.summary: Review created from an issue is in strange state

Just wanting to double check with you guys before filing the bug report

This doesn't work in JIRA Studio.

fields.summary: Resetting Studio icon to default sets it to a broken icon

fields.description:
In Studio June, there was an option in the Look and Feel screens to customise the colour of the drop-down arrows in the header. This is because if you set the header to white, the default white arrows will not be visible.

!StudioColoursJune.png!

In July, this option has disappeared from the Look and Feel screen.

!StudioColoursJuly.png!
fields.summary: Drop-down arrow colour customisation has disappeared from Look and Feel screen in July release

fields.description:
If I commit against a review, e.g. CR-APL-232, and include that in my commit comment, and the *issue* APL-232 is closed, and the commit hooks are enabled to require an open associated issue, and I have another issue in the message, but it's after the review key, then my commit is rejected.

to test, try a commit like "CR-APL-1 APL-2: some message" when APL-1 is closed and APL-2 is open.
fields.summary: The SVN commit hooks for requiring an issue also trigger on review keys

fields.description:
When attempting to fetch artifacts from the local shared repository, there seems to be a problem with the SSL certificate.

Example build: https://studio.atlassian.com/builds/build/result/viewBuildLog.action?buildKey=STRM-TRUNK-BAM&buildNumber=26
fields.summary: Artifact sharing not working on StAC

fields.description:
Tender Support Online Helpdesk Software (http://tenderapp.com/) is emerging as an easy-to-setup, easy-to-use competitor of Zen Desk for online help and support.

This ticket is a request to provide deep integration between the two tools, so that a Product Suppport specialist updating a ticket in Tender results in that ticket being updated for the Developer in JIRA Studio, and vice versa.  Not just one-way creation sync.

Others with more intimate knowledge of Tender please describe how you could see integration between the two tools actually working.
fields.summary: Integrate with Tender Support

fields.description:
1) Install the June release branch.
2) Upload a custom icon and favicon.
3) Upgrade to the JIRA 4.4 integration branch by sshing into the machine and running install-studio.sh in the new fireball.

The custom icons have changed back to the default Studio logo.
fields.summary: Custom Studio icons and favicons are lost on upgrade to JIRA 4.4 integration branch

fields.description:
1) Administration->General->Look and Feel->Edit Configuration
2) Tick "Customize Studio Colors"
3) Enter some valid custom settings into the "Date/Time Formats" section and save.

At this point, the custom settings are shown on the main Look and Feel page.

4) Click "Edit Configuration" again.

The fields are now empty. Clicking "Update" resets them to the defaults.
fields.summary: Date/Time Format settings are lost when editing Look and Feel settings

fields.description:
There is no immediately apparent way to get to your Confluence profile. IIRC, it's possible through a convoluted set of navigation, but not easy for customers - I'm not sure of the navigation path though.

Important settings are available on your personal Confluence profile, which should be accessible to users. Porting these to the JIRA profile would also be an acceptable solution, albeit less maintainable.
fields.summary: Cannot easily access wiki profile to edit settings such as whether shortcuts are enabled.

fields.description:
*Conditions*
This issue only occurs when the window including the search results is superimposed over another IE window.
The issue will not occur if the window including the search results has more than one open tab
This issue does not occur in FF5

*Steps to reproduce*
Do a search that will yield multiple pages of results
Click a link to another page, the browser will lose focus and switch to the IE window underneath (in the attached video, the window underneath is the Bing search results)
fields.summary: IE8 windows loses focus when paging through search results

fields.summary: After upgrading to JIRA 4.3, the Embedded Crowd upgrade task could throw NPE in XML restore in functional tests

fields.description: You can already enter an issue key to jump to that issue. It would be nice to extend that to changesets as well.
fields.summary: Entering a Subversion revision number into the quick search box (like r126644) should let me jump to that changeset in FishEye

fields.description: Trying to insert a Google Spreadsheet or Presentation via the {{\{gdocument\}}} macro doesn't work, you need to use {{\{gspreadsheet\}}} or {{\{gpresentation\}}} respectively, but in the Notation Help (domain.jira.com/wiki/renderer/notationhelp.action) it shows only the {{\{gdocument\}}} macro.
fields.summary: No mention of {gspreadsheet} or {gpresentation} macros for embedding Google documents in Confluence help

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 17 September 2014|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Hi everyone,
 
Thanks so much for your votes and comments on this issue.
 
Atlassian is working hard on Atlassian Connect, Atlassian's strategic integration platform enabling ecosystem vendors to develop add-ons for Atlassian Cloud (OnDemand). Atlassian Connect 1.0 [was released in March 2014|http://blogs.atlassian.com/2014/03/introducing-atlassian-connect-1-0/], and you can already get access to [more than 50 public add-ons today built using the platform|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/search?application=&category=&cost=&hosting=cloud&marketingLabel=].
 
Due to stability and scalability reasons, we will not bundle additional third party add-ons with our Cloud offerings. But you should feel free to contact the vendors of your favourite add-ons to let them know that you would like them to create a Cloud version of the add-on! We will do our best to work together with the vendor to satisfy this request.
 
Since we have no plans to bundle additional add-ons in Cloud, we are closing this issue.
 
Cheers,
Bartek
JIRA Product Management
bartek (at) atlassian (dot) com
{panel}
 
 
*Original request description:*
Can we please have this plugin installed into Dev Studio instance.  We wpuld like to be able to link our Decv Studio instance with Onepoint Project Management.

See http://www.onepoint-project.com/products/options#
fields.summary: Plugin Installation - Onepoint Jira Connector Option
Improvement on Bamboo Documentation and Bamboo Site

fields.description: For example, if you have people that sign up on a public jira site as collaborators, but you have lots of developer licenses, then when you move a collaborator to be a developer license, you don't want that public user to automatically become a member of the JIRA developers group.  There should be a way to set licensing for users independent of actual permissions.
fields.summary: Ability to set licensing for users without affecting permissions

fields.description: Support for https://studio.plugins.atlassian.com/wiki/display/CRPT/Crucible+Reporting+Plugin this plugin would be great.
fields.summary: Crucible Reporting Plugin

This will prevent OOMs occurring due to customers having large diffs on single files.
fields.summary: Apply sequence limits for FECRU diffs by default

fields.description:
After performing an upgrade test on Unicorn from the June to the July release, the Issues admin menu does not render.

Please note - I don't know if this is a problem with the code itself or the Unicorn deployment process.

Repro steps:
1) cd to the 105 stable branch.
2) mvn -Punicorn; cleanDeployUnicorn
3) Populate some data into the instance once it's running.
4) cd to the jira-integration branch
5) mvn clean install -Pskiptests (If you don't do a manual clean/install first before going to the unicorn command-line, you get mixed versions of dependencies - it doesn't clear up properly).
6) mvn -Punicorn; deployUnicorn
7) Try to navigate to the Issues admin menu.

You get a malformed view of the General Permissions page, and the General admin menu remains on the left.

!IssuesMenuAfterUpgrade.png!

I've attached the HTML source of the page (IssuesMenu.htm).
fields.summary: Issues admin menu does not render after upgrade
